intro: Renvoizea trinii, commonly known as the Maori flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is characterized by its aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers. It is often found in wetlands, streams, and other freshwater environments. Renvoizea trinii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various invertebrates and serving as a food source for native birds.
